meanings.definition: The act of enunciating or stating clearly and distinctly.
meanings.sent1: Her enunciation of the speech was flawless.
meanings.sent2: His enunciation of the rules was easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: The robot's enunciation of the alphabet was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The enunciation of the verdict echoed through the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enunciation of the lesson made it easy to remember.

meanings.definition: The manner or style in which something is enunciated.
meanings.sent1: I admired her elegant enunciation of the poem.
meanings.sent2: His enunciation of the song lyrics was passionate.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated enunciation of jokes made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The enunciation of the news was delivered with authority.
meanings.sent5: The actor's enunciation of the lines brought the character to life.

meanings.sent1: Proper enunciation is crucial for clear communication.
meanings.sent2: Her enunciation of the foreign words was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's enunciation of words was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The enunciation of the vowels was emphasized in the lesson.
meanings.sent5: Clear enunciation helps in avoiding misunderstandings.
